prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Step 1: Load required libraries
library(DESeq2)
library(readxl)
library(data.table)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(factoextra)

# Step 2: Read count table and annotation data
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
annotation_data <- fread("SRP021193.colData.tsv")

# Step 3: Prepare count table and annotation data for DESeq2 analysis
rownames(count_table) <- count_table$Gene
count_table <- count_table[-1] # Remove gene name column
colnames(count_table) <- colnames(count_table)[-1] # Remove sample name column
coldata <- annotation_data[, .SD, .SDcols = c("group", colnames(count_table))]
rownames(coldata) <- coldata$sampleid
coldata <- coldata[-1] # Remove sampleid column

# Step 4: DESeq2 analysis and finding group-specific genes
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = count_table, colData = coldata, design = ~ group)
dds <- DESeq(dds)
res <- results(dds)
group_specific_genes <- lapply(unique(coldata$group), function(g){
  top_genes <- rownames(res)[which(res$padj < 0.05 & res$log2FoldChange > 1 & coldata$group == g)]
  return(top_genes)
})

# Step 5: Plot PCA using group-specific genes
group_specific_counts <- count_table[group_specific_genes[[1]],]
for (i in 2:length(group_specific_genes)) {
  group_specific_counts <- rbind(group_specific_counts, count_table[group_specific_genes[[i]],])
}
pca <- prcomp(t(group_specific_counts))
pca_df <- data.frame(PC1 = pca$x[, 1], PC2 = pca$x[, 2], Group = coldata$group)

ggplot(pca_df, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = Group)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "blue", "green")) +
  geom_text_repel(aes(label = rownames(pca_df)), size = 3)
```
Note: Make sure to install the required libraries before running the code.
